title: Using RAG in Your MCP Client

overview.title: What You'll Learn
overview.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to leverage your RAG knowledge base directly from your MCP client (Claude, Cursor, etc.) to enhance your AI assistant with your own documentation and knowledge.
overview.learn1: How to use the pluggedin_rag_query tool
overview.learn2: Writing effective queries for your knowledge base
overview.learn3: Combining RAG queries with other MCP tools
overview.learn4: Best practices for contextual information retrieval

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.item1: Plugged.in account with MCP proxy configured
prerequisites.item2: At least one document uploaded to your Library
prerequisites.item3: MCP client (Claude Desktop, Cursor, etc.) connected
prerequisites.item4: Basic understanding of RAG from the 'Building a RAG Knowledge Base' tutorial

step1.title: Understanding the pluggedin_rag_query Tool
step1.description: The pluggedin_rag_query tool is automatically available in your MCP client when connected through Plugged.in. It allows you to search through all documents in your current project's library.
step1.tip: The RAG system uses vector similarity search, so it can find relevant information even if you don't use exact keywords from your documents.
step1.screenshot: Screenshot: Claude Desktop showing pluggedin_rag_query in available tools
step1.screenshotDesc: The tool appears in your MCP client's tool list

step2.title: Basic RAG Queries
step2.description: Start with simple queries to search your knowledge base. The tool will return the most relevant chunks from your documents.
